#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "======================================"
echo "   SYSTEM PERFORMANCE REPORT"
echo "   $(date)"
echo "======================================"
echo ""

echo "--- CPU SUMMARY ---"
mpstat 1 1 | tail -1
echo ""

echo "--- LOAD AVERAGE ---"
uptime
echo ""

echo "--- MEMORY USAGE ---"
free -h
echo ""

echo "--- DISK I/O (5 sec average) ---"
iostat -x 1 5 | grep -A 20 "^Device"
echo ""

echo "--- TOP 5 CPU CONSUMERS ---"
ps aux --sort=-%cpu | head -6
echo ""

echo "--- TOP 5 MEMORY CONSUMERS ---"
ps aux --sort=-%mem | head -6
echo ""

echo "--- TOP 5 I/O PROCESSES ---"
pidstat -d 1 1 | grep -v "^#" | sort -k4 -rn | head -6
echo ""

echo "--- DISK UTILIZATION ---"
df -h /
echo ""

echo "--- NETWORK ACTIVITY (5 sec) ---"
sar -n DEV 1 5 | grep Average
echo ""

echo "======================================"
echo "DIAGNOSIS:"
echo "======================================"

# Analyze and provide recommendations
iowait=$(mpstat 1 1 | tail -1 | awk '{print $6}' | cut -d. -f1)
mem_available=$(free -g | grep Mem | awk '{print $7}')

if [ "$iowait" -gt 10 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸  HIGH I/O WAIT ($iowait%) - Disk bottleneck detected"
    echo "   Recommendations:"
    echo "   â€¢ Check slow queries: iotop -o"
    echo "   â€¢ Consider faster storage (SSD)"
    echo "   â€¢ Optimize database queries"
    echo ""
fi

if [ "$mem_available" -lt 2 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸  LOW MEMORY ($mem_available GB available)"
    echo "   Recommendations:"
    echo "   â€¢ Identify memory leaks"
    echo "   â€¢ Consider adding RAM"
    echo "   â€¢ Reduce application memory usage"
    echo ""
fi

load=$(uptime | awk -F'load average:' '{print $2}' | awk '{print $1}' | tr -d ',')
cores=$(nproc)
if (( $(echo "$load > $cores" | bc -l) )); then
    echo "âš ï¸  HIGH LOAD AVERAGE ($load > $cores cores)"
    echo "   Recommendations:"
    echo "   â€¢ Investigate runaway processes"
    echo "   â€¢ Scale horizontally if possible"
    echo ""
fi

echo "âœ“ Report complete!"
EOF

    echo "Disk I/O:"
    iostat -x 1 1 | grep -E "(sda|sdb)" | head -2

    echo "Top processes by CPU:"
    ps aux --sort=-%cpu | head -4 | tail -3
    sleep 5
done
EOF
